Articles.Content:
Posting on behalf of my son, who is using KSP 1.11.0. He is using the following mods: KRPC, Copernicus, FMRS Continued, Parallax 1.1b, Toolbar Control, Camera Tools. This is is problem - thanks to anyone who can shed any  light:

Quote

 

When I last played Kerbal space program, I came across a weird glitch with KRPC. The code I entered made the game glitch and all the stages activate simultaneously. I then used 'Revert To Launch', but the game showed what's in the link below.

https://imgur.com/a/4Lpj5Xc

I could only control: better time warp, docking mode, altitude mode, time mode and NavBall hide/show.

@KerbalDad  I would recommend trying to reproduce the bug with only KRPC installed. If it keeps happening, then it's an issue with KRPC and you should ask the developers of that mod. If it stops happening then it's an issue with another mod and you can find which mod that is by removing the other mods one by one and testing it.

1 hour ago, KerbalDad said:

Posting on behalf of my son, who is using KSP 1.11.0. He is using the following mods: KRPC, Copernicus, FMRS Continued, Parallax 1.1b, Toolbar Control, Camera Tools. This is is problem - thanks to anyone who can shed any  light:

 

This is an interesting one, likely due to the way the mods are interacting. 

  • all stages activating simultaneously is likely an issue with the way KRPC was used. I've not seen it occur, but it sounds like an easy mistake to make in KRPC. 
  • FMRS handles reverting afterwards.

It's worth noting FMRS doesn't appear to have a released version for KSP 1.11 (although I didn't dive into the thread to check, the title was 1.9.0) and krpc hasn't been updated for a while either, so both of these issues could be down to outdated mods. 

More than likely, one caused the other, otherwise there'd probably be a lot more noise about FMRS / KRPC not working. It's likely there was either a bug or error in KRPC or the way it was used, which then staged everything - FMRS likely took one look at all the erroneous stages that had been generated and panicked. 

 

Still, not a great deal that can be done at this stage. If it happens again, grab the KSP.log file and link to it here so we can see what's causing the problem.
